text: Margaret D. H. Keane (born Peggy Doris Hawkins; September 15, 1927 - June 26, 2022) was an American artist. She mainly painted women, children, and animals in oil or mixed media. Keane's works are recognizable by the big, doll-like eyes of the people she painted."Tim Burton 'Big Eyes' Movie Tells The Story Of Art Couple Margaret and Walter Keane...", Huffington Post, April 4, 2013. Retrieved 2013-06-09. In the 1960s, her artwork was sold under the name of her husband, Walter Keane, who claimed credit for it. They went to court and Margaret won the case. Keane died on June 26, 2022 in Napa, California from heart failure, aged 94.Margaret Keane, Painter of Sad-Eyed Waifs, Dies at 94 ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American painters Category:People from Nashville, Tennessee
title: Margaret Keane
